listing.description:
Summary

Blackbox is a new shipping company from the creators of Cards Against Humanity. Our mission is to help people sell and ship stuff directly to their fans for a fraction of the cost and effort of doing it themselves.

We’re looking for a data-nerd-ish person to manage new-client projects, shepherding those projects through every stage from Kickstarter to final fulfillment, while applying creative problem-solving and clear communication.

Philosophy

The role and the team require a positive, “can-do” attitude and approach. You’ll need to get into the details, solve problems, and make things happen—the buck stops with you. Nobody on the team is above any task—we all pitch in to get things done, we collaborate, we communicate, and we help each other.

Type of Work

What will you really be doing in this gig? You’ll be guiding Blackbox client projects through the the fulfillment process—crunching data, maintaining a catalog of products, calculating and organizing, and getting things done so that Blackbox can successfully ship the client products to customers.

Here are some more details on your responsibilities:

  • Working on Shipping Projects
    • Data management: Formatting and transmitting order data.
    • Manage Product Catalog/Database: Enter new products, manage product specifications, understand the details.
    • Quoting projects for clients: Create detailed quotes using our pricing model and client’s order data. Understand different scenarios/possible arrangements.
    • Manage Orders: Special orders (e.g., for conferences and events), wholesale orders, etc.
  • Working with Internal Blackbox Teams
    • You’ll be the contact for our Customer Service team regarding details of client projects.
      • Answer questions from individual Customer Service team members.
      • Work with Customer Service to sort out strategy and policies/approach.
    • You’ll work with our Accounts people to take over the day-to-day details of projects, once clients have signed on with Blackbox.
    • You’ll work with our Operations people to make sure warehouses are prepared for client inventory, properly equipped to ship the products, and aware of any procedural notes.
    • You’ll work with our Tech people concerning customer data and product information.
  • Problem-Solving
    • We’ll have sizable product launches and other big client projects. You’ll know all the details and be knee-deep in the hoopla.
    • Track down missing information.
    • Answer questions, fix problems, communicate updates.
  • Process Documentation and Improvement: Understand and document the processes for client projects:
    • What information do we need from/about clients, their products, and their customers?
    • How can we provide realistic and reliable expectations and timelines to clients and customers?
    • How can we make things more efficient and better?

Qualities You Should Have

For this role, it is essential to have these skills:

  • Organization: You should be a very organized person (though you’ll also need to roll with some chaos without getting too anxious). You should be able to manage a complicated checklist/process with a lot of moving parts, keep track of a lot of information, and document what’s happening.
  • Process Orientation: You should have a process/system for the client projects—know what the steps are, understand contingencies, and look for ways to simplify, streamline, or otherwise improve how we’re doing things.
  • Communication: You must be able to write, speak, and think clearly. You’ll need to ask and inform in ways that are clear, effective, and unambiguous.
  • Logical Thinking/Problem Solving: The ability to apply reason and rational thinking to analyze situations and problems. There’s a fair amount of detective work in this job, and you need to be able to think through things, analyze what’s going on, and figure out what the options are. You’ll also have to MacGyver some stuff.
  • Getting It Done: You need to be a person who can get things across the finish line yourself. You will be encouraged to ask questions, and you will have help and support, but you need to be able to get things done on your own, to surmount obstacles, and to ask yourself the question, “What should I do next?”—and answer it for yourself.

Additionally, the kind of approach and general work/human skills you bring to bear will also be important.

Here are some of the important qualities we’re looking for:

  • Empathy and Compassion: The value of these things should never be underestimated. A lot of your job will be problem-solving, and dealing with potentially annoying and stressful situations. The ability to put yourself in someone else’s shoes, and to foster understanding and cooperation, will be invaluable and will make life better for everyone. Really.
  • Sense of Humor: This has nothing to do with being “joke funny.” Rather, it indicates the ability to maintain a sense of perspective, even when situations (and people!) get aggravating—which they will.
  • Technical Skills: You should be pretty good (but not necessarily a wizard) at Excel—e.g., know some formulas, be good at formatting. You don’t need to be a coder, but you should know your way around a computer. Having some experience with software tools for organizing work/projects will be helpful. Also, having a sense of spatial relations or playing a musical instrument can’t hurt.

What’s in it for you?

Money, health insurance, vacation time, and other benefits. You’ll be part of a small company and small team, so you’ll really be in the mix. There’s a lot of opportunity to work autonomously, to learn, and to experience variety and challenge in your work. It’s a casual, informal (but professional and hard-working) work environment, and interesting projects and people are often crossing our path. There’s opportunity to work remotely part of the time, and as you establish your credibility, you’ll have increased freedom to shape the job.

If this sounds appealing to you, please get in touch.
listing.title: Accounts Coordinator

company.tagline: Helping sell & ship stuff for much less time & effort.
company.name: Blackbox Inc.

listing.description:
Summary

Blackbox is a nascent shipping company. Our mission is to help people sell and ship stuff directly to their fans for a fraction of the cost and effort of doing it themselves.

We’re looking for someone to manage our client accounts—”clients” are the people who are making/selling/Kickstartering the stuff that we will ship. This gig is about being the point person for those clients, finding them, deciding who will be an appropriate client, communicating clearly, and applying creative problem-solving.

 

This is a full-time position based in Chicago. You’ll report to the Chief Operating Officer.

Philosophy

The guiding philosophy of our team is this: Be nice, and try hard.

What does that mean? “Be nice” means everyone is expected to be compassionate, supportive, respectful, and collaborative; that pertains to the way we interact with our colleagues, vendors, customers, food servers, mail carriers—everyone. You should always be on good behavior; frustrations are part of any life and any job, but we should all approach the situations with a sense of humor and humanity. “Try hard” means putting your best effort into the work, upholding your responsibilities, helping your colleagues, and carrying your weight. Do what you would hope someone working for/with you would do. Make your work and your approach something that you (or anyone) can be proud of.

The role and the team require a positive, “can-do” attitude and approach. You’ll need to get into the details, solve problems, and make things happen—the buck stops with you. Nobody on the team is above any task—we all pitch in to get things done, we collaborate, we communicate, and we help each other.

Type of Work

What will you really be doing in this job? You’ll be the point person for finding, “selling” to, and communicating with Clients. You’ll formulate a strategy for finding good Clients, you’ll bring them onboard, and you’ll communicate with them to ensure the success of their projects and the relationship.

Here are some details about your responsibilities:

  • Communicating with Clients
    • Explain Blackbox’s services to potential clients.
    • Evaluate potential clients to determine if Blackbox is right for them, and vice-versa.
    • Understand client needs, and how those fit with Blackbox capabilities.
    • Understand our competition, and make improvements to make our service better.
    • Develop price quotes for clients.
  • Collaborating with the Team
    • You’ll work closely with the other members of the Accounts team, as well as the Logistics team (to get projects out the door), the Product Team (to improve our software, reporting, etc.), Marketing team, and Customer Service team.
  • Influencing the Direction of the Business
    • Understand our Clients’ needs/wants, and competition, and recommend/make improvements to make our service better.
  • Problem-Solving
    • We’ll have sizable product launches and other big projects. You’ll know all the details and be knee-deep in the hoopla.
    • Answer questions, help fix problems, communicate updates.
  • Process Documentation and Improvement
    • Understand and document the processes for every facet of our sales, client-onboarding, and account-management processes.

Qualities You Should Have

For this role, it is essential to have experience and expertise in these things:

  • Sales/Account Management: You’ve formulated a plan for a customer/client portfolio, and you’ve succeeded in meeting that plan by finding and bringing on the appropriate target customers/client.
  • Customer/Client Service: You’ve worked directly with clients/customers—explaining services, understanding needs, creating quotes, communicating throughout the process. You also understand how to field complaints and suggestions in a way that is constructive and defuses tensions.

Additionally, what is crucial is the kind of approach and general work/communication skills you’re able to apply.

Here are some of the important qualities we’re looking for:

  • Empathy and Compassion: The value of these things should never be underestimated. A lot of your job will be problem-solving, and dealing with potentially annoying and stressful situations. The ability to put yourself in someone else’s shoes, and to foster understanding and cooperation, will be invaluable and will make life better for everyone. Really.
  • Writing: You need to be able to write coherently and convey the appropriate tone.
  • Speaking: The ability to articulate verbally, and to listen. You should be able to make your points clearly; but just as importantly, connect with people when speaking, understand and extract their thoughts and concerns, and even help them disentangle their own thinking.
  • Logical Thinking/Problem Solving: The ability to apply reason and rational thinking to analyze situations and problems. There’s a fair amount of detective work in this job, and you need to be able to think through things, analyze what’s going on, and figure out what the options are. You’ll also have to MacGyver some stuff.
  • Organization: You should be a person who digs organization (though you’ll also need to abide some chaos without getting too anxious). You should always be on the lookout for ways to improve things, and be able/interested to document the steps in a process so that things can be repeated and improved.
  • Getting It Done: You need to be a person who can get things across the finish line. You will be encouraged to ask questions, and you will have help and support, but you need to be able to get things done on your own, to surmount obstacles, and to ask yourself the question, “What should I do next?”—and answer it for yourself.
  • Sense of Humor: This has nothing to do with writing jokes or doing stand-up comedy. Rather, it indicates the ability to maintain a sense of perspective, even when situations (and people) get aggravating—which they will. It means understanding—as my dad used to say— that ”It’s all part of the fun.”
  • Technical Skills: You should be handy with a computer. Experience (but not necessarily wizardry) with Excel (e.g., knowing some formulas, understanding formatting, sorting, and filtering) will be useful. You certainly don’t need to be a coder, but you should know your way around a computer. Also, having a sense of spatial relations or playing a musical instrument can’t hurt.

What’s in it for you?

Money, health insurance, vacation time, and other benefits. You’ll be part of a small company and small team, so you’ll really be in the mix. There’s a lot of opportunity to work autonomously, to learn, and to experience variety and challenge in your work. It’s a casual, informal (but professional and hard-working) work environment, and interesting projects and people are often crossing our path. There’s opportunity to work remotely part of the time, and as you establish your credibility, you’ll have increased freedom to shape the job.

If this sounds appealing to you, please get in touch.

listing.description:
You're deeply passionate about your work, quality minded, and excited about the prospect of improving and saving lives by designing brilliant digital products. If that sounds like you we'd love for you to be a part of our brand-new digital health design company – Mend.


At Mend, we produce digital interventions that work in tandem with medicines to improve the way diseases are treated and controlled – on a global scale. As an integrated part of Trifork eHealth, Mend will be responsible for driving complex regulatory design projects for top-tier clients across pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and biotech.


We're on a mission to innovate the health sector with digital solutions and respect that our designs become an integrated part of the daily lives of people with chronic and contagious diseases.


A dedication to high-quality user experience utilizing the latest technology, a creative mindset, and a commitment to working in compliance with the latest regulatory requirements are all core capabilities that fuel our growth and ambitions. Get ready to join a fast-moving company within a new industry that holds enormous potential.


What you'll do

– Design digital products with state of the art user experiences
– Use the findings of user research as the basis of your designs
– Have an empathic and a user-focused approach to design
– Be detail-oriented and deliver pixel perfect and seamless visual designs
– Take part in all phases of product development, from strategy to launch
– Iterate continuously by building and testing prototypes of products
– Collaborate closely with designers, user researchers, developers, medical professionals etc.
– Communicate your ideas and decisions clearly, to colleagues as well as clients

You are…

– A team player, and ready to act as an integral part of multi-disciplinary teams
– Open-minded and flexible when it comes to your work approach, always picking the right tools for a given problem
– Interested in inventing new design tools and processes (namely for design system and product quality management)
– Have a general technical understanding, that enables you to incorporate technology in your designs
– Read job descriptions carefully, and put a green heart emoji in the title of your email when contacting us
– Deeply passionate about your work, and about improving and saving lives by developing digital products
– Curious, ambitious, and eager to learn on the job


Requirements

– At least 5+ years of relevant experience
– Experience working in all phases of product design
– Solid understanding of visual design and brand identity systems
– Experience with prototyping tools
– A mix of passion, curiosity, and a healthy level of perfectionism
– English fluency (written and spoken)


Experience and Skills That Are Huge Pluses

– User research and testing
– Programming (especially scripting and front-end development)
– Animation and motion graphics
– Copywriting
– Type design
listing.title: Senior Digital Product Designer
listing.howto_apply:
Send your CV and, more importantly, your portfolio. The important thing is to demonstrate your work and to give us a feeling of who you are.

NB: We're aware that talented folks often don't have time to maintain a portfolio. You don't need a fancy interactive website – a simple PDF will suffice.

If you have any questions regarding the position, contact design director Jonas Krøner at jkn@trifork.com.

listing.description:
FRONT END DEVELOPER | JOB DESCRIPTION

GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES

As part of our nimble Digital Experience team, you will join the Senior Front End Developer in crafting the look, feel, and story of Magnolia—from design to code—across our digital platforms. You want clean, modular UIs and even cleaner, more reusable code. You create systems to solve problems, and know how to manage your time. You look ahead, keep learning, and always ask why. At Magnolia, you'll find a brand with integrity, and a family that loves what they do. Let's do good work together.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIP

 

This position reports to the E-commerce Manager.

 SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

 

  • Design and develop user-facing sites, pages, and features.

  • Build efficient and reusable front-end systems.

  • Consult on web-related requests from other departments.

  • Devise and implement brand design and code standards consistently across UIs.

  • Identify and address performance issues.

  • Communicate and apply front-end best practice

  • Other duties as assigned

 QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

 

  • 3-5 years of professional development experience.

  • Command of HTML, CSS (SASS), and related web technologies.

  • Knowledge of mobile-first and responsive web development practices.

  • Strong knowledge of Javascript, including modern JS libraries and tooling.

  • WordPress and/or Shopify theme development experience.

  • Familiar with git and common git dev workflows.

  • Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations.

  • Viewable work, either live or on Github / Codepen / personal site. Must at least have a GitHub account.

  • Use of common web performance and compatibility testing tools.

  • Familiarity with one of the following for designing mockups: Photoshop, Sketch, Figma.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk or hear and taste or smell.  The employee is frequently required to stand and walk.  The employee is frequently required to climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

 WORK ENVIRONMENT

 

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 COMPETENCIES

 

  • Building Trust

  • Coaching

  • Continuous Learning

 ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS

 

EOE Statement:

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

 The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by an employee in this classification. It is not to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory or all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications of employees assigned to this job. Management has the right to add to, revise, or delete information in this description at any time.

 

Magnolia is a lifestyle brand founded by Chip and Joanna Gaines that encompasses a variety of businesses based in Waco, Texas. A few of these branches include a brick and mortar retail store, an online retail store, vacation rental properties, a real estate company, a lifestyle magazine, a restaurant, a bakery and a design and construction firm. Magnolia is a company that believes there is something inherently good in hard work and doing good work that matters turns a job into a passion. We take pride in offering rewarding careers that come with great benefits, and we value the kind of people who are eager to learn and grow alongside us. When you join the Magnolia team, you join the Magnolia family.
listing.title: Front End Developer

listing.description:
Job description

Reading Plus is looking for front-end engineers to join our Product Development team. You will collaborate closely with all team members to build a functional and scalable architecture for web applications that serve millions of students and educators.

 

What you will do:

  • Connect front-end with back-end services
  • Monitor, test and continuously optimize your code
  • Deliver modern, testable and maintainable code
  • Collaborate with other engineers, product owners/managers, UX designers, and QA
  • Work in an environment that supports both, your team's advancement and your individual growth
  • Ensure that our customer’s experience is the very best it can be

 

Who you are:

  • Your personal values align with ours (knowledge, empathy, commitment & collaboration)
  • You are intimately familiar with agile development paradigms
  • You are adaptable, resourceful and able to develop effective solutions to problems
  • You have a proven background building user-friendly, data-rich progressive web applications
  • You are experienced with modern JavaScript coding, testing, debugging and automation techniques
  • You care about web technologies, exploring data, usability and design
  • You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, and are happy to communicate your ideas clearly
  • You have experience with continuous delivery and automated testing
  • You value team success over personal success

 

Technologies:

  • Polymer library (substitute React or Vue)
  • Web components (Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, HTML Imports & Templates)
  • Git (no substitute)
  • JavaScript (Async, Promises, Service Workers)
  • CSS (familiar with the latest W3C working group snapshot)

 

Bonus:

 

  • A degree in Computer Science or adjacent areas
listing.perks:
Happy to assist with relocation.
Dog-friendly office.
Much, much more...
listing.title: Front-End Engineer

company.tagline: We help students become successful readers & lifelong learners.
company.name: Reading Plus

listing.description:
At Logical Position, we’re on a mission to help businesses grow. With nearly 5,000 clients and 6 locations across the U.S., we’re one of the fastest growing digital marketing agencies in the country. And we love what we do! We’re rated highly on Glassdoor and ranked #3 Best Workplace in America by Inc. Magazine. Every day we hustle to deliver exceptional outcomes for our clients while enjoying the amazing company culture we’ve worked hard to build. From catered meals and company parties to free event passes and outdoor excursions, we create an environment where our team can thrive. If you’ve got the drive to succeed and a passion for growth, we’re looking for you!   

 

Department: Website Development 

Location: Deer Park, IL 

Pay: $45k/yr & up (DOE) 

Benefits: Health/Dental/Vision + 401(k) + Life + LTD Insurance 

Hours: Full-time, Monday - Friday 

 

The Job in a Nutshell: 

We are looking for a creative, talented and motivated individual who wants to continue a website design career. You will work as a part of our Website Development team taking WordPress sites from start to finish-- if you have a knack for modern design and experience creating or customizing pre-made WordPress themes and plugins, we would love to see your portfolio! Most work will be done using WordPress but occasionally clients may need work done on non-WordPress sites, so experience with additional content management systems is a plus.  

  

What You Will Love Doing: 

  • Creating custom websites from pre-made themes using WordPress and create hard-coded non-WordPress websites for clients as needed 
  • Helping develop a library of WordPress themes for quick use 
  • Installing code snippets and plugins on client websites 
  • Managing the development and implementation of client website designs from start to finish 
  • Coordinating with other departments to ensure client requirements and needs are met prior to launch 
  • Using advanced knowledge of code languages and content management systems 
  • Staying up to date with emerging technologies 
  • Identifying opportunities for new features and product offerings 

  

To Fit the Bill: 

  • Bachelor's Degree in a related field or applicable professional experience 
  • 2+ year(s) recent WordPress design experience, including the use of WooCommerce 
  • Experience manipulating and customizing pre-made WordPress themes 
  • Comfortable adding/troubleshooting various WordPress plugins 
  • Strong HTML, PHP, CSS3, and MySQL knowledge 
  • Ability to work with/create hard-coded non-WordPress sites  
  •  Experience building responsive sites  
  •  Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
  • Experience with Photoshop or other photo editors 
  • Have an online portfolio of demonstrated work 
  • All candidates must be eligible to work in the United States without visa sponsorship 

  

To Score Extra Points: 

  • Strong Adobe CS skills 
  • Experience with Gutenberg 
  • Understanding of Custom Post Types 
  • Experience with a CSS preprocessor, such as Sass or LESS 
  • Working knowledge of JavaScript/jQuery 
  • Strong knowledge of CMS’s other than WordPress 
  • Understanding of basic SEO principles 
  • Experience with REST APIs
listing.title: Website Developer - Wordpress

listing.description:
Interviewing for a new company is a serious time commitment for all parties involved. Please take the time to read this and thoughtfully consider if we would be a good fit for one another. This is a full-time position. You must be located in Texas and be able to interact in person with our team in McKinney, TX. No contractors or agencies. Seriously.

Why We Started PestRoutes

Several years ago, we were searching for the right software for managing a pest control office to connect our sales module that we built for sales team. We looked and looked for something that was cloud-based, mobile friendly, and actually would make the life of our customers easier. We were SHOCKED to find nothing that met our customer expectations.

We kept thinking to ourselves, "why doesn't someone make something that the customers would love?" Finally, we realized it was up to us. Since then we have dedicated our lives to creating the world's greatest software for managing pest control offices--and we have succeeded!

We’ve got lofty goals for rapid growth—we need you to continue to push the boundaries of what is possible using software to solve day-to-day challenges. You will not only be part of something great but will have opportunities to accelerate your career in ways not available to many people.

What You’ll Be Working On

You will be working on a platform that runs a field service company B2E. Your work will impact every part of the customer lifecycle including sales, marketing, scheduling, CRM, billing, mobile field service applications, communication (SMS, email, voice, snail mail, push notifications, etc...), credit card processing, reporting, customer portals, reviews, and more! We work with dozens of APIs and frameworks and are truly a platform on which our customers utilize as their primary and central tool.

PestRoutes is currently rebuilding our Mobile Applications. After our MVP is launched you’ll continue to implement new features, improve existing functionality, fixing bugs, and creating documentation for our internal team as well as our customers.

This Role: Mobile Applications Engineer

We collaborate with the customer success team and technical support to define the most needed areas of improvement. Your job will focus on implementing the features and functionality assigned to you from our CTO who will set the priorities in collaboration with these teams. These assignments range between bug fixes, new reports, an assortment of new features, and code improvements.

The platforms are diverse between mobile, desktop, customer-facing, and internal use. What you do here matters and will be used by thousands of people. It is therefore extremely important that code is not only tested and bug-free, but also maintains our standards of quality so that we can continue to be the best pest control software in the world. There will be a lot of complex and hairy problems we will ask you to solve under tight deadlines. We expect you to not only solve these problems but to solve them well.

How We Operate

You cannot build something great without a solid foundation. PestRoutes has been built upon a solid foundation of core values. We use these before we hire any team member and we recognize and promote our people based on how these values are demonstrated. This is where the true strength and power of our product comes from. Learn more about our values on PestRoutes.com.

Our standard workweek is Monday - Friday, and our office is open between the hours of 8:00 am and 5:00 pm or 9:00 am and 6:00 pm.

How You’ll Be Compensated

We believe in fair compensation, depending on your skill and experience, you can expect to make somewhere between $90,000 and $140,000 annually upon joining the company. We have an excellent health plan available to our employees, and we cover 100% of the cost of the premium of a Blue Cross Blue Shield Bronze PPO plan for our each of our employees. You can also elect to pay for an upgrade to the plan we offer and to cover dependents.

Additional Perks: Twice a month we will either all go out as a team to lunch or dinner or cater a meal into the office. This helps us all take a breath and build team unity. We also provide an assortment of free drinks and snacks in the office for your enjoyment.

Holidays / Paid Time Off - We offer 10 paid vacation days + the following holidays: Memorial Day, President’s Day, Labor Day, 4th of July, Christmas (3 days), New Years, Thanksgiving (2 days). PTO is accumulated and increases by two days per year, up to a max of 20 days PTO.

We also offer 5 sick days per calendar year to cover personal or immediate family health concerns.

This position is on-site.

Currently, the PestRoutes staff works full-time in McKinney, TX. When you start working at PestRoutes, you’ll pair with our development team rebuilding the mobile app, to learn the ropes of the product and code-base, third-party integrations, deployment, business decisions, etc.

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
  • 3+ years expert level React Native
  • 3+ years expert level working with mobile apps that have offline capabilities
  • 1+ year with iOS native development. We use native code for few features integrated with React Native app
  • 1+ year with Android native development. We use native code for few features integrated with React Native app
  • 3+ Ability to implement complex and core features into a mature code base
  • Strong knowledge of mobile UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect to back-end service
  • Proven ability to track down, solve, and release solutions to bugs and issues
  • Experience with version control and deployment strategies
  • High attention to detail and ability to take responsibility for core changes
  • Passion for development and high desire to release code
  • Experience with Realm or SQLite databases

 

How To Apply

This is a full-time employment opportunity for a single individual. We’re not looking for contractors, part-time individuals, or agencies of any kind. Applicants must be located in Texas. Thanks!

To apply, please send us a note to jobs-pestroutes@verypossible.com with {{PestRoutes Mobile Engineer}} in the subject line. Please include the following:

  1. What’s most important to you from a company culture and operating environment?
  2. What are the biggest things that de-motivate you and make you unhappy when it comes to being an independent engineer within a company?
  3. Your resume
  4. Code samples with comments explaining what you did and how you architected the code.
listing.title: Mobile Applications Engineer

listing.description:
Our purpose:

Healthcare is confusing. It’s hard to access, to understand, and to ensure you’re getting the right care that leads to the right outcomes. Grand Rounds exists to make a difference in all of it. Our vision is to craft a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. We work alongside company’s insurance plans, helping to guide people to the best care for them.

 

Our team:

We’re a tight, collaborative team of product designers, marketing designers, and user experience researchers, working in close partnership with our product management and engineering teams. We are passionate advocates for all our users - from our award-winning Care Team, to our doctors and clinicians, to the members that use our products every day. We realize that we have the opportunity to transform a confusing and archaic system and we relish the challenge of making life better for the people that need us the most.

 

You!

We’re looking for a Product Designer craft a better future with us. Somebody who can envision and deliver delightful, insightful, and engaging experiences which will guide our Members to achieve better health outcomes. You’ll help us transform how people access, understand, and interact with their care.

You have crafted and delivered insightful experiences that brought clarity to complex situations. You possess an innate curiosity and a drive to understand people’s motivation and behavior. You think systemically and find joy in figuring out how all the pieces fit together. You love educating people on how to best uncover and address user needs through elegant and insightfully designed experiences.

Cross-functional peers across the organization come to you for advice on how to better understand the impact they’re delivering in marketing, sales, and product.  Your clear and inviting communication brings people along, and your empathy and connection help them effectively reach their users.

You build positive relationships with product managers, engineers, and front-line support. You value open and honest discussion and are always looking to learn. You wholeheartedly empathize with the human side of the patient experience and want to make healthcare delightful.

 

Requirements:

  • A body of work that clearly demonstrates insight, empathy, and an ability to tackle complex problems on behalf of users
  • Minimum 6 years of experience in design, with an emphasis on shipping useful, usable, and delightful products
  • Mastery of current design tools, responsive web design standards, and the current state-of-the-art for consumer-facing experiences
  • Passionate advocacy for high-quality design, execution, and implementation of interactive web sites and mobile apps.
  • Experience developing, testing, and refining concepts based on research, insights, and brand vision.
  • Comfort managing a project from inception through execution.
  • Able to see the broader picture while delighting in the quality and nuance of the specifics.
  • Compelling communication capabilities. You understand that sharing the insights is the most impactful part of what you do.  

 

Rounds is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Grand Rounds considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
listing.title: Senior Product Designer

company.tagline: We are reimagining and transforming how people experience health care
company.name: Grand Rounds

listing.description:
About Us:

Grand Rounds' vision is to create a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. Founded in 2011, the company provides an employer-based technology solution that connects members and their families to high-quality care. With Grand Rounds, employers get a personalized, high-performance network at scale, while their employees get the tools and support needed to navigate their care on their own terms. Named Rock Health’s 2018 Fastest Growing Company, Grand Rounds helps restore individual health and quality of life, and offers employers lower health care spend and higher employee productivity. For more information, please visit  www.grandrounds.com.

 

Our Purpose:

Healthcare is confusing. It’s hard to access, to understand, and to ensure you’re getting the right care that leads to the right outcomes. Grand Rounds exists to make a difference in all of it. Our vision is to craft a path to great health and health care, for everyone, everywhere. We work alongside company’s insurance plans, helping to guide people to the best care for them.

 

Our team:

We’re a tight, collaborative team of product designers, marketing designers, and user experience researchers, working in close partnership with our product management and engineering teams. We are passionate advocates for all our users - from our award-winning Care Team, to our doctors and clinicians, to the members that use our products every day. We realize that we have the opportunity to transform a confusing and archaic system and we relish the challenge of making life better for the people that need us the most.

 

You!

We’re looking for a deeply curious Lead UX researcher who is intrigued by the uniqueness of each person, while being able to discern the patterns in group behaviors. If you strive to understand the underlying motivations of seemingly contradictory decision making, in order to help companies and individual help themselves, we might have a perfect role for you.

You’re excited to own an entire research portfolio and program end-to-end.  You know the kind of questions that can benefit from your experience and expertise, and you’re eager to find and share the answers.  You’ve run qualitative research studies that have uncovered insights that have changed the course of your Products - and you’ve helped your team feel confident when they’re on the right track.

 

You are passionate about generative research.  You know that we’re often answering the wrong question and that a little more digging often uncovers the question that we should be asking.  You’re comfortable telling the organization uncomfortable truths about what we’re doing - with clarity, compassion, and conviction.

Cross-functional peers across the organization come to you for advice on how to better understand the impact they’re delivering in marketing, sales, and support.  Your clear and inviting communication brings people along, and your empathy and connection let them see the world from the user’s perspective.

 

Your work demonstrates your strengths, and an innate curiosity to understand people’s needs and working styles. You build positive relationships with product managers, engineers, and front-line support. You value open and honest discussion and are always looking to learn. You wholeheartedly empathize with the human side of the patient experience and want to make healthcare delightful.

 

Requirements:

  • A body of work that clearly demonstrates insight, empathy, and an ability to tackle complex problems on behalf of users, showcasing the value you’ve delivered.
  • Excitement in helping teams define the problems they’re trying to solve, coupled with passion for getting them to the answers they need.
  • Minimum 6 years of experience in UX Research, with an emphasis on supporting the creation of useful, usable, and delightful products
  • Experience with developing, testing, and refining research based on best-practices, foundational methodologies, and emerging understanding of human behavior. Confident with a variety of prototyping and user research methodologies.
  • Deep comfort with current research methodologies, accessible web design standards, and the current state-of-the-art for consumer design experiences
  • Compelling communication capabilities. You understand that sharing the insights is the most impactful part of what you do.  

Bonus points:

  • Experience with Design Sprints.  Double bonus points for facilitation exposure.
  • Setting up user research programs in a B2B2C world
  • Partnering with Sales and Marketing to refine our messaging so it reflects the power of our brand and our tools
  • Real passion for the Grand Rounds product suite; belief that our services can transform how we access and utilize healthcare

 

Grand Rounds is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Grand Rounds considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

For more information, please visit  www.grandrounds.com​.

Somebody who can envision and deliver delightful, insightful, and engaging experiences which will guide our Members to achieve better health outcomes. You’ll help us transform how people access, understand, and interact with their care.

You’re excited to own an entire design system and styleguide end-to-end. You have crafted and delivered insightful experiences that brought clarity to complex situations. You think systemically and see how all the pieces visually fit together. You love educating people on the merits of gradients versus textures. You possess a deep and abiding fondness for fonts and look for ways to bring together styles in engaging and unusual combinations.

Cross-functional peers across the organization come to you for advice on how to better understand the impact they’re delivering in marketing, sales, and product. Your clear and inviting communication brings people along, and your empathy and connection help them effectively reach their users.

Your work demonstrates your strengths, and an innate curiosity to understand people’s needs and working styles. You build positive relationships with product managers, engineers, and front-line support. You value open and honest discussion and are always looking to learn. You wholeheartedly empathize with the human side of the patient experience and want to make healthcare delightful.

Requirements:

  • ●  A body of work that clearly demonstrates insight, empathy, and an ability to tackle complex problems on behalf of users.

  • ●  Passionate advocacy for high-quality design, execution, and implementation of interactive web sites and mobile apps.

  • ●  Ownership in building and shipping design systems. Deep expertise about typography, layout, and color exploration. And a willingness to make the whole team smarter about their uses.

  • ●  Minimum 8 years of experience in design, with an emphasis on shipping useful, usable, and delightful products.

  • ●  Experience developing, testing, and refining concepts based on research, insights, and brand vision.

  • ●  Mastery of current design tools, responsive web design standards, and the current state-of-the-art for consumer-facing experiences.

  • ●  Compelling communication capabilities. You understand that sharing the insights is the most impactful part of what you do. 

 

Bonus Points:

  • ●  Partnership with engineering to build and extend UI frameworks that translate design concepts into fully realized code elements.

  • ●  Collaboration with Sales and Marketing to refine messaging so it reflects the power of the brand and the tools.

  • ●  Experience with Design Sprints.

  • ●  Real passion for the Grand Rounds product suite; belief that ourservices can transform how we access and utilize healthcare. 

  •
